title: Restored Order Crackdown
outcome: Hardline Directorate seizes initiative and enforces a rapid restoration of BCI control, justifying crackdown as necessary to prevent 'anarchy.' Dissent organizers and vocal Council opponents are detained in high-profile, publicized operations. Stern propaganda broadcasts signal return to compliance. Yet, citywide unease grows—new, aggressive BCI flags lead to arbitrary restrictions; communities, now experienced with analog workarounds, begin to resist and sabotage digital checkpoints. Council splits deepen as some members covertly undermine Directorate messaging.

events.description: Directorate declares emergency to restore BCI authority. Armed teams detain protest leaders and outspoken Council critics in coordinated sweeps across the city.
BCI scoring is reinstated with heightened sensitivity, causing a surge in flagged citizens facing sudden travel bans, service denials, and public warnings.
Propaganda broadcasts highlight 'stability restored,' even as system flaws cause confusion and hardship in multiple sectors. Communal resistance quietly increases.
Widespread analog sabotage—graffiti, signal jamming, and fake checkpoint badges—disrupts Directorate efforts. Some Council members secretly support these acts to undermine Directorate rule.
Cracks within Directorate and Council are exposed as pro-civilian and hardline camps feud publicly over arrests and continued BCI abuses, leading to mass demonstrations outside Council chambers.
